result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jon F Moreland

defendant.name: Moreland, Jon F

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jon F Moreland
Current: 225 N Main Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2022)
Prior: 29267 145th Street, Mc Gregor, IA 52157

10:48 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jon F Moreland appeared by phone, in custody in Winneshiek County Jail.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Jon F Moreland.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard and requests a breakout room. 
10:49 AM Breakout Room 
10:52 AM Court Resumes 

Attorney Erickson waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each of the five counts.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:38 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jon F Moreland appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Jon F Moreland.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard and ready to proceed. 

1W - Deputy M. Ploessl, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Erickson 

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Erickson objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Attorney Erickson requests arraignment for another date.
Arraignment scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement.

1:46 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jon F Moreland in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jon F Moreland.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF149 and 22CF122 called for initial appearances.

Attorney Erickson is heard.  Appears in all defendants cases, but will make a special appearance for 22CF149.

22CF149 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.   
22CF122 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

2:35 PM - 22CF149
Attorney Erickson is heard on bond. Requests a signature bond.
State is heard. Does not recommend bond modification. 
Court reduces the bond to $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement.

10:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jon F Moreland appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wynes appearing for defendant. 

Court finds probable cause. Court comments on six pending cases with warrants. 

State requests that bond be set at $3,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. 

Attorney Wynes is heard and requests a signature bond or a lower cash bond amount. 

Court orders a cash bond of $5,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. 

Court will cancel warrants in the following cases: 22CF122, 20CF17, 19Ct12, 19CF99, 19CF79, 19CF74 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement.
